content.description: Climb thin finger crack to a ledge.  Use anchors for "Little Stinker" to descend.
content.location: Directly right of " Thunder Run".

content.description: Pretty straightforward, positive climbing leads to a ledge and little runout to a bolt above a small roof.  Pull the roof on marginal rock, then clip the chains.
content.location: Immediately left of Bossy, in the middle of the dark face

content.description:
Short but sweet.

One or two moves of finger crack to over a small bulge to face climbing.
content.location:
Just right of

Little Stinker

content.description: It's a(nother) unremarkable chosspiece in the entablature.
content.location: First line on your left as you descend from Sunshine Wall.

content.description: slightly on you climbing leads to anchors, too short to be anything worth going on about but its decent.
content.location: 2nd climb from left.

content.description: Easier climb between two harder routes.  Crux down low with nice holds to bolted anchor.
content.location: To the left of "Shadow Arete"

content.description: Start on the left side of the recessed alcove, making weird stemmy moves past the first two bolts before cutting left onto the arete to the top.
content.protection: 6 bolts, bolted anchors without rap chains (can walk off). First bolt is awkward to clip.
content.location: Left side of the recessed alcove near the right end of Fat Man Wall.

content.description: Start under the roof and traverse out right up towards a well-chalked thin crack.  Continues more right, then up to the chains.  A little pumpy and a lot fun.
content.location: Starts under the roof, just right of Tease me Please me

content.description: Hard-to-read moves through the initial roof lead toward a huge jug.  Without the right sequence, the jug seems improbably far away.  Clip the second bolt from the jug, side-pull your way to the third bolt (keeping your cool as a fall before clipping the third would be nasty), and finish on easier climbing.
content.location: Immediately right of Monsters Under My Monster's Bed

content.description: Tricky through the low roof with some side-pulls and partial chimney moves, then much easier to the chains.
content.location: Immediately right of Monsters Under My Bed, finishing on the same anchor

content.description: Start with a fun bulge/roof for two bolts, then climb the face above past three more bolts to an anchor.
content.location:
4 routes down from

Thunder Run

content.description:
This lil' stinker packs a whole lotta climbing into a short route.

Follow an arete with a thought provoking crux above the third bolt.

Anchor is set back on a ledge so better not to top rope this one.
content.location: First route on Skinny Man

content.description: Climb thin finger crack to a ledge.  Traverse the ledge left to lower off of "Litttle Stinker" anchors.
content.location: Directly right of "Thunder Run"

content.description: Start up the alcove face just left of the left-facing dihedral.  The guidebook suggests stem moves off the right wall until the second bolt.  After that point, things get pretty chossy in the crack and on the right face.  To avoid the right wall felt pretty contrived to me, but fun nonetheless.
content.location: Immediately right of Fat Man Returns, in the left-facing dihedral

content.description: Akward climbing on the right side of a recessed alcove with a funky crux at about mid-height.
content.location:
first bolted route to the left of

Little Stinker

.

content.description: Starts in a stemming corner and then through a fun sequence of thin technique moves before finishing on bigger holds to surmount a small roof.
content.location: First route to the right of Shadow Arete (and the wasp nest)

content.description: Stick clip desirable for first bolt.  Climb up two bolts then clip the fourth bolt of "Cheeseburger" and continue right to share finish and anchors with "Cheeseburger with Fries".  Not easily top roped due to the traversing nature of the route.  Also, beware of loose rock while lowering.
Pull through the roof on good holds, trend right, and move up the higher face.
content.location: Left end of Fat Man Wall, just right of Tease Me Please Me

content.description: As with the other climbs on this wall, begin with an overhanging, hard start.  A number of side-pulls and underclings are available for your right hand after pulling off the ground.  Stem and thrash your way through the open dihedral, clip, and then finish on easier terrain.  The finishing wall looks blank and is a choose-your-own-adventure (right or left) to the chains.
content.location: Immediately right of The Crippler

content.description:
Don't hit any crippler before jumping on The Crippler.

Climb through a low roof to a scary third clip on crimps to a sustained difficult face above.

If you blow the second clip you may land on a sharp boulder.

Good climb though, well sorta.
content.location:
3 routes right from

Monsters Under My Bed

, just right of Oblivion.

content.description: Pull a tricky starting move (or two, depending on your reach) on difficult feet to latch a positive horn.  Fall into a left gaston and now you're within striking distance of the first bolt.  Another few moves and a couple more clips will get you past the goods and onto easier terrain.
content.protection: 7 bolts.  The first bolt is about 15 feet up.  Either stick clip or be really solid at the grade.  There are no sticks in the desert, so you'd need to bring a stick clip.
content.location: Right of Pornstar (5.10c), there are two routes with tough starts and high first bolts.  This is the right of the two.  Once past the hard bits, head for the anchor on the left.

content.description: Start on "Cheeseburger" then climb right and finish on top half of "Extra Value Meal".
Start in a corner and gain a ledge on easy terrain. Some thinner moves at the top bring you quickly to the anchor. A bit soft for the grade.
content.protection: Just to the right of the corner and left of Monsters Under My Bed
content.location: 5 bolts

content.description: With a name like Bloody Roids and an X rating, it has to be a Bill Robbins special.  Climb the chimney located between Fat man and Skinny Man Walls.  Exit right onto the "Little Stinker" ledge.  X-rated in guide but protects well enough with adequate gear.
content.protection: Bring big cams, two #5 and #6.  One fixed Pin that may or may not still be fixed.

content.description:
Starts out easier than Fat and Sassy, but leads to a tricky crux about 2/3 of the way up.  The feet get more sparse at the same time that the hand holds get less positive.   With the sequence dialed, it's much more reasonable.

After pulling the crux and clipping the last bolt, you can either finish straight up to the two lone bolt hangers with no chains or you can cut left and finish on the anchor of Fat and Sassy.
content.location: Between Fat and Sassy and Fat Man Returns

content.description: Open project to the right of "Dark Power"  Like most climbs on this wall, the difficulty starts at the bottom with hard moves through an overhang, then sequential face climbing above.  Climb to a ledge then make a few more moves to reach the anchors.
content.location: Furthest right route on Skinny Man Wall.
